abstract.text: Renders a view’s content as if it’s rotated in three dimensions around
the specified axis.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The angle by which to rotate the view’s content.
The axis of rotation, specified as a tuple with named
elements for each of the three spatial dimensions.
A two dimensional unit point within the view about which to
perform the rotation. The default value is
The location on the z-axis around which to rotate the
The relative vanishing point for the rotation. The
Use this method to create the effect of rotating a view in three
dimensions around a specified axis of rotation. The modifier projects
the rotated content onto the original view’s plane. Use the
value to control the renderer’s vanishing point. The
following example creates the appearance of rotating text 45˚ about

code: Text("Rotation by passing an angle in degrees")

inlineContent.text: In visionOS, create this effect with
instead. To truly rotate a view in three dimensions,
use a 3D rotation modifier without a perspective input like

SwiftUI-PageImage-card.png.alt: A black Swift logo on a swirly blue and purple background.

SwiftUI-View-rotation3DEffect.alt: A screenshot of text in a grey box. The text says Rotation by passing an angle in degrees. The text is rendered in a way that makes it appear farther from the viewer on the right side and closer on the left, as if the text is angled to face someone sitting on the viewer’s right.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
A geometric angle whose value you access in either radians or degrees.
Constants that define how a view’s content fills the available space.
A normalized 2D point in a view’s coordinate space.
A point that’s centered in a view.
A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides
modifiers that you use to configure views.
Constrains this view’s dimensions to the specified aspect ratio.
Renders a view’s content as if it’s rotated in three dimensions around
the specified axis.
Applies a projection transformation to this view’s rendered output.
Rotates the view’s content by the specified 3D rotation value.
Rotates the view’s content by an angle about an axis that you specify
as a tuple of elements.
Renders a view’s content as if it’s rotated in three dimensions around
the specified axis.
Rotates a view’s rendered output in two dimensions around the specified
point.
Scales this view’s rendered output by the given amount in both the
horizontal and vertical directions, relative to an anchor point.
Scales this view’s rendered output by the given horizontal and vertical
amounts, relative to an anchor point.
Scales this view by the specified horizontal, vertical, and depth factors.
Scales this view to fill its parent.
Scales this view to fit its parent.
Applies a 3D transformation to the receiver.
Applies an affine transformation to this view’s rendered output.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.

seeAlsoSections.title: Scaling, rotating, or transforming a view
